title: Premium Eagle Logo Replacement, Animation, and Header Alignment Fixes

requirements.summary: Replace existing SwiftOps logo with premium futuristic eagle head logo featuring geometric design, sharp angular edges, neon cyan glow, and high-contrast white with cyan accents
acceptanceCriteria: Old logo is completely removed from all components
New eagle head logo has geometric, angular design with sharp edges
Logo features neon cyan glow effects matching the website's color scheme
Logo uses high-contrast white with neon cyan accent colors
Design is aggressive yet clean, avoiding cartoon/mascot aesthetics
Logo is rendered in SVG format for scalability

file_operations.description: Replace the existing logo SVG implementation with the new premium eagle head design. Import and integrate the generated eagle logo image from frontend/public/assets/generated/eagle-logo.dim_512x512.png. Ensure the component supports both icon and full variants, maintains neon cyan glow effects, hover animations, and pulsing radial background. Preserve all existing props (variant, size) and styling capabilities while using the new geometric eagle head design.

Update the full-screen eagle animation component to use the new premium eagle head logo asset from frontend/public/assets/generated/eagle-logo.dim_512x512.png. Maintain all existing animation stages (fade, draw, expand, particles, pulse, scale, fadeout) and ensure the geometric eagle design renders correctly throughout the animation sequence. Preserve the isActive prop trigger and onComplete callback functionality.

Verify that the EagleLogo component integration in the hero section displays the new premium eagle head logo correctly. Ensure the animated eagle logo, floating particles, and CTA buttons work seamlessly with the updated logo design. No structural changes needed, only visual verification that the new logo integrates properly with existing parallax and animation effects.

requirements.summary: Add smooth 2-4 second entrance animation to eagle logo on page load with fade-in, scale-in, and glow pulse effects using smooth easing
acceptanceCriteria: Logo animation duration is between 2-4 seconds
Animation includes fade-in, scale-in, and glow pulse effects
Animation uses smooth easing functions for premium feel
Animation triggers automatically on page load
Animation runs only once per session/page load
Logo remains visible immediately after animation completes
Animation performs smoothly on both desktop and mobile devices
No janky frames or performance issues during animation

file_operations.description: Add a one-time entrance animation that triggers on component mount. Implement CSS animations or Framer Motion with 2-4 second duration including fade-in (opacity 0 to 1), scale-in (transform scale 0.8 to 1), and glow pulse effects. Use cubic-bezier easing for smooth premium feel. Track animation state (using localStorage or sessionStorage) to ensure it runs only once per page load/session. After animation completes, logo should remain visible at full opacity and normal scale. Optimize animation performance using CSS transforms and opacity for GPU acceleration.

Add CSS keyframe animations for the eagle logo entrance effect including fade-in, scale-in, and glow-pulse animations with smooth easing functions (cubic-bezier). Define animation classes that can be applied to the logo for the 2-4 second entrance sequence. Ensure animations use transform and opacity properties for optimal performance and avoid layout thrashing.

requirements.summary: Fix header alignment of contact email to display fully in single line without wrapping, with proper vertical alignment and consistent spacing across all viewports
acceptanceCriteria: Email address displays on a single line on all screen sizes
No text wrapping or line breaks occur on mobile, tablet, or desktop
Email is vertically aligned with other navbar items
Consistent spacing maintained between logo, navigation menu, and email
Layout remains functional and readable on mobile (320px+), tablet (768px+), and desktop (1024px+) viewports
Email text does not overflow or get cut off

file_operations.description: Fix the contact email (zeeshan.automation06@gmail.com) alignment and display issues. Apply CSS properties to prevent text wrapping: white-space: nowrap, overflow: hidden if needed with ellipsis on very small screens, or use responsive font sizing. Ensure vertical alignment with other navbar items using flexbox align-items: center. On mobile viewports, consider adjusting layout to prevent overflow (e.g., moving email to a separate row or hamburger menu if space is constrained). Maintain consistent padding and spacing between logo, navigation links, and contact details across all breakpoints (mobile 320px+, tablet 768px+, desktop 1024px+).

requirements.summary: Optimize header layout for responsive design ensuring perfect alignment, no overlapping elements, consistent spacing, and professional appearance across all devices
acceptanceCriteria: Header elements do not overlap on any screen size
Padding and spacing remain consistent across breakpoints
Layout adapts gracefully from mobile to desktop
Visual hierarchy is maintained on all devices
Professional appearance is preserved across all viewports
Touch targets are appropriately sized for mobile interaction

file_operations.description: Implement comprehensive responsive design optimizations for the header. Use CSS Grid or Flexbox with appropriate breakpoints to prevent overlapping elements. Define consistent padding and spacing variables for mobile (320px+), tablet (768px+), and desktop (1024px+) viewports. Ensure touch targets are at least 44x44px for mobile usability. Add media queries to adjust layout flow on smaller screens (e.g., stacking elements or using hamburger menu if needed). Maintain the professional SaaS/AI startup visual hierarchy and neon cyan theme across all breakpoints. Test and verify no overlapping occurs between logo, navigation menu, and contact email at any viewport size.

requirements.summary: Optimize performance by compressing logo asset, ensuring animation does not delay rendering, and maintaining smooth scrolling and navigation
acceptanceCriteria: Logo file size is optimized (compressed without quality loss)
Logo animation does not block initial page render
Page loads quickly with optimized logo asset
Smooth scrolling performance is maintained
Navigation interactions remain responsive
No frame drops or stuttering during scrolling or navigation
Core Web Vitals (LCP, FID, CLS) remain healthy

file_operations.description: Optimize logo loading and animation performance. Ensure the eagle logo image from frontend/public/assets/generated/eagle-logo.dim_512x512.png is properly optimized (it should already be compressed by the image generation system). Use lazy loading attributes or React.lazy if appropriate. Implement the entrance animation using CSS transforms and opacity for GPU acceleration to avoid blocking the main thread. Consider using will-change CSS property sparingly for animation optimization. Ensure animation does not delay initial page render by starting after component mount. Verify no layout shifts (CLS) occur during logo loading or animation.

Add performance-optimized CSS for logo animations using transform and opacity properties only (GPU-accelerated). Consider adding will-change: transform, opacity to elements that will animate, but remove it after animation completes to avoid memory issues. Ensure smooth scrolling is maintained by avoiding expensive CSS properties in animations (no box-shadow changes during animation, use filter: drop-shadow instead if needed). Verify that global styles do not interfere with scroll performance.
